decks.notes: The main focus of this UR Control deck is to control the board with a mix of counterspells, removal, and card draw while utilizing powerful creatures like Azure Fleet Admiral and Murmuring Mystic to pressure the opponent. Tolarian Terror and Skred are used to deal with opposing threats, while cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain help dig for key cards. The mana base is built around Snow permanents to support cards like Lórien Revealed and to take advantage of Volatile Fjord. This deck aims to outlast opponents through strategic plays and efficient removal.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using low-cost creatures and burn spells. Guttersnipe and Kessig Flamebreather provide additional damage when casting spells, while Sneaky Snacker and Voldaren Epicure offer early aggression. Fiery Temper, Fireblast, Lightning Bolt, and Lava Dart are used as burn spells to finish off opponents. Faithless Looting helps with card selection and Grab the Prize and Highway Robbery provide additional resources. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creatures and direct damage spells to secure a quick victory.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game through a combination of countering spells and creatures, while also utilizing card draw and mill effects to disrupt the opponent's strategy. By utilizing creatures like Cryptic Serpent and Tolarian Terror, as well as Murmuring Mystic to generate tokens, the deck aims to pressure the opponent while maintaining control of the game. The inclusion of cards like Mental Note, Thought Scour, and Lórien Revealed allow for efficient card draw and graveyard interaction, while Counterspell and Dispel protect against opposing threats. Overall, the deck's goal is to outlast and outmaneuver the opponent through a combination of control and aggression.

The deck focuses on utilizing walls like Axebane Guardian and Overgrown Battlement to generate a large amount of mana, while also using creatures like Quirion Ranger and Priest of Titania to further ramp up mana production. The goal is to assemble the combo of Freed from the Real enchanting a high-toughness creature to generate infinite mana, allowing for a game-winning play like Reaping the Graves or Valakut Invoker for a massive burn finish. This deck aims to control the board with defensive walls until it can assemble its combo for a powerful win condition.

The main idea of this deck is to play low-cost creatures with hexproof and then stack them with powerful auras to create a fast and aggressive strategy. By utilizing cards like Ancestral Mask, Armadillo Cloak, Rancor, and Ethereal Armor, the deck aims to quickly pump up its creatures to overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Abundant Growth and Utopia Sprawl also helps to ramp up mana production for faster plays. This deck is all about leveraging the synergy between auras and hexproof creatures to create a potent aggro strategy in the Pauper 1 vs 1 format.

The main strategy of this deck revolves around utilizing graveyard recursion and creature sacrifice to reanimate powerful creatures quickly. By filling the graveyard with cards like Stinkweed Imp and Satyr Wayfinder, the deck aims to bring back creatures like Lotleth Giant and Generous Ent using spells like Dread Return. The deck also includes utility creatures like Scrapwork Mutt and Rubblebelt Maverick to support the reanimation strategy. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to all colors needed for the deck's spells.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Arbor Elf, Utopia Sprawl, and Wild Growth to play powerful creatures early on. There is a mix of aggressive creatures like Avenging Hunter and Boarding Party, as well as supporting cards like Eldrazi Repurposer and Writhing Chrysalis. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of early aggression and powerful mid-game threats, utilizing the Gruul color combination for a mix of efficient beatdown creatures and mana acceleration.

This deck focuses on using Persistent Petitioners as a repeatable mill combo, supported by cards like Mothdust Changeling and Winding Way to draw more Petitioners. Forecasting Fortune Teller and Pond Prophet help with card selection, while Generous Ent provides ramp. Masked Vandal deals with opponent's threats, and Gnaw to the Bone helps with staying alive. The mana base includes lands that support the deck's colors. Lead the Stampede helps refill the hand with creatures.Overall, the deck aims to mill the opponent out while maintaining board presence and card advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to use the Balustrade Spy to mill through the deck and put as many creatures as possible into the graveyard. The deck then utilizes cards like Dread Return to bring back powerful creatures from the graveyard and overwhelm the opponent with a large number of creatures on the board. The deck also includes mana ramp creatures like Priest of Titania and Overgrown Battlement to help accelerate the deck's game plan. The goal is to quickly assemble a board presence that is difficult for the opponent to deal with.

This deck focuses on generating mana quickly with cards like Goblin Anarchomancer and Thornscape Familiar, allowing for explosive combos with cards like Seething Song and Big Score. The deck also utilizes card draw and manipulation with Glimpse the Impossible and Burning Curiosity to dig for combo pieces and finish the game with Pirate's Pillage. The combination of mana acceleration, card draw, and combo potential makes this deck a dangerous and unpredictable force in the Pauper 1 vs 1 format.

The focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent while also utilizing burn spells to finish them off. By playing aggressive creatures like Guttersnipe and Sneaky Snacker, and using spells like Fiery Temper and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to chip away at the opponent's life total. Using cards like Fireblast and Highway Robbery, the deck can close out the game swiftly if the opponent's life total is low. The key strategy is to maintain pressure through early aggression and burn spells until victory is achieved.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive Rakdos creatures and cheap burn spells. By combining creatures like Kitchen Imp and Voldaren Epicure with direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Fiery Temper, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. Additionally, cards like Faithless Looting and Grab the Prize help to maintain card advantage and consistency. The deck also includes lifegain options like Alms of the Vein and Vampire's Kiss to ensure survival in longer games. Land choices like Jagged Barrens and Bojuka Bog provide extra utility and versatility.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly cycle through cards and fill up the graveyard in order to cast powerful spells like Reaping the Graves and Songs of the Damned. By utilizing cards like Street Wraith and Drannith Healer, the deck can generate a lot of mana early on with Lotus Petal and Cabal Ritual to cast multiple spells in a single turn. The goal is to create a massive graveyard and then bring back key creatures and win conditions with Reaping the Graves to overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with low-cost aggressive creatures like Burning-Tree Emissary and Goblin Bushwhacker, supported by burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast for reach and removal. Rally at the Hornburg helps to maintain pressure and refill the board after board wipes. The inclusion of Clockwork Percussionist and Experimental Synthesizer provides utility and the ability to generate additional value. The deck aims to consistently apply pressure and finish the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

This Pauper 1 vs 1 deck is focused on aggressive creature options, with a mix of efficiency and versatility in its choices. Utilizing mana ramp with Arbor Elf, Utopia Sprawl, and Wild Growth, the deck can quickly get ahead on board presence. Jewel Thief offers card advantage, while Ram Through provides removal. The deck also includes Eldrazi Repurposer for recursion, and Writhing Chrysalis for creating blockers or aggressive creatures. With a blend of aggressive creatures and support spells, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents early on and maintain pressure throughout the game.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of low-cost creatures, known as "Weenies." By utilizing cards like Thraben Inspector and Novice Inspector to generate card advantage and Kor Skyfisher for additional value, the deck aims to maintain a steady stream of threats. The inclusion of combat tricks like Guardians' Pledge and Prismatic Strands helps to protect the creatures and ensure a strong offense. Battle Screech provides a powerful finisher, and Journey to Nowhere offers removal options. Overall, the deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents with aggressive, efficient creatures.
